description: Erection of roof extensions and change of use from the existing garage to two bedroomed shally bungalow
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Unnumbered Site Location Plan, TH 3409 LSCP, 1894/D&S/01, Regulations Compliance Report, Fire Safety Strategy, Environmental Report, Energy Statement, Design Rationale & Planting Specification, U-Value Calculation (Element type: Wall - Masonry - full cavity fill: slabs), U-Value Calculation (Element type: Roof - Pitched roof - insulated ceiling), U-Value Calculation (Element type: Floor - Slab-on-ground floor), Daylight & Sunlight Report received 4 July 2022; 21/3455/1, 21/3455/3, 21/3455/4 received 20 July 2022; 21/3455/20 Rev A, 21/3455/21 Rev B, 21/3455/22 Rev A received 15 August 2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - The windows formed in the first floor rear elevation shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.
Condition : 5 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the dwelling hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out. Furthermore, no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the side walls of the dwelling hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 8 - The front, side and rear garden shall be divided as shown on the plan drawing 21/3455/20 Rev A and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 9 - The details of hard and soft landscaping as shown on the approved plans and specifications shall be laid out and planted before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 10 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 20.8 percent reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the development the applicant shall have entered into a formal agreement with the Council to provide a payment of ?4,408.72 towards its Carbon Offset Fund, as outlined in the hereby approved Energy Statement.

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, evidence (schedule of installed fittings and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105L/person/day or less.

Condition : 13 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a space shall be laid out within the site in accordance with approved plan no. 21/3455/21 Rev B for three bicycles to be parked and that space shall thereafter be kept available for the parking of bicycles. Photographic evidence shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority upon completion as verification, prior to the first commencement of the use

Condition : 15 - The approved refuse and recycling store as shown on approved plan no. 21/3455/21 Rev B for shall be completed and made available for use before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, and thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction. Bins shall be stored within the store at all times and shall not be left on the public highway.

Condition : 16 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of the boundary treatment along Stucley Road shall first have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall indicate the positions, heights, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected. The details so approved shall be carried out as approved and shall be completed before the accommodation hereby permitted is first occupied.

Condition : 17 - The house hereby approved shall be used solely as a single family house (Use Class C3) and shall not be used for business purposes and or as a house in multiple occupation, including any use within Class C4 of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or such other legislation as may subsequently supersede it.
